name: chateaubriand
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large, thick piece of fillet steak (= good-quality meat cut from the middle part of a cow's back): We had chateaubriand, served with béarnaise sauce and croquette potatoes. Other fillet cuts, such as chateaubriands, are also suitable for this dish.
More examplesFewer examplesFor a romantic meal, surely the only choice is the chateaubriand to share.The priciest items on the menu are sole meunière and chateaubriand.The chateaubriand is offered for two and is carved at the table.
